name: Sedan
description: A sedan is a car with a three-box body style, meaning it has a separate trunk compartment. Sedans are typically four-door cars, but there are also some two-door sedans available.

name: Coupe
description: A coupe is a two-door car with a sloping roofline. Coupes are typically sportier than sedans and often have less seating capacity.

name: SUV
description: An SUV, or sport utility vehicle, is a vehicle that combines the features of a passenger car and a light truck. SUVs are typically taller and have more ground clearance than cars, making them more capable of off-road driving.

name: MPV
description: An MPV, or multi-purpose vehicle, is a type of vehicle that is designed to be both versatile and functional. MPVs typically have seating for seven or more passengers and offer a lot of cargo space.

name: Hatchback
description: A hatchback is a car with a two-box body style, meaning it has a combined passenger and cargo compartment. Hatchbacks are typically smaller and more fuel-efficient than sedans or SUVs.

name: Wagon
description: A wagon is a car with a three-box body style, but with a larger cargo compartment than a sedan. Wagons are typically more practical than sedans and offer more cargo space.

name: Convertible
description: A convertible is a car with a retractable roof. Convertibles are typically driven in sunny weather and offer the driver and passengers the ability to enjoy the open air.
